Pins

Version:MissionOS_2.0

Pins are a useful way to record information on the system for particular activities. The pin is dropped at a particular location, allowing the user to add a comment and attach a file (documents or photos). More entries can be added at a later date so that a history of events can be recorded in a single location and readily retrieved in the future. You can upload a single photograph to the pin.

To place a Pin perform the following steps:

  1. Click Place or edit pin.
    The drop pin function appears.

 

  1. The drop pin function is activated.
  2. Place the pin in the desired location on the map.
    A popup appears.
  3. In the popup, upload the image.
  4. Add a description. 
  5. Select Active work area/Temporary Work in Progress/Incident/ Accident options. 
  6. Assign the pin to a contract. 
  7. Add an attachment. 
  8. Click Save Pin.

 

The pins can be turned on or off using the Place or edit Pin toggle. To view a pin just click on it within the map then click on the content you wish to view.

There are 3 types of drop pin colors indicating different construction status:

  • No Construction Activity in Yellow
  • Construction Activity in Progress in Green
  • Temporary Work In Progress in blue

Further construction activities and pin colors may be added to this feature and changed in a similar manner:

  1. Select the drop pin that you want to update with different construction activity.
  2. Click once to open pin details.
  3. Select the check box next to active work, this changes the status of construction and tip color.
  4. Select the check box next to Temporary Work In Progress to activate the tip to Blue.
  5. If Incident/Accident option is checked, pin color changes to Red.
  6. If no option is selected, pin displays in Orange color.

Access to this function is determined by your login status - Admin, Editor and Approver are able to edit/update and delete the information in the pin.
